content: knitting pattern gravestone requirements one size fits most finished hat is 9 in/23 cm a simple hat in garter stitch and ribbing knitted tall with circumference 20 in/51 cm bottom-up in the round stretches to fit heads up to about 24 in/61 cm ● yarn any worsted weight i used lion brand pound of love 100% acrylic 1020 yards/933 meters in 454 grams ● yardage needed about 115 yards/105 meters ● needles us size 8 5 mm or size needed to get appropriate gauge you will need a circular needle about 16 in/40 cm long and a set of double pointed needles in the same size or a circular capable of doing magic loop ● gauge/gauge approximately 17 sts and 33 row in 4 in/10 cm measured in garter stitch ● other materials scissors and yarn needle for weaving in ends instructions cast on 84 stitches with the technique of your choice i used long tail join to begin working in the round work twisted rib k1tbl p1 for 8 rounds work garter column pattern ● round 1 k around ● round 2 k3 p9 around the alternating knit and purl row form the columns of garter stitch there are seven of these columns this pattern was initially published under the working title squish helmet stitches once more secure by sewing a stitch continue in pattern for 28 rounds 14 garter or two on the inside ridges or until desired length then begin decreases to shape the crown of the hat finishing weave in ends we will decrease by doing a k2tog at the beginning and end of each garter stitch section abbreviations on the rounds noted and then p3tog on a purl round when only three stitches remain in the k = knit garter section other than the p3tog all p = purl decrease rounds are worked on a round of plain sts = stitches knitting parentheses = repeat the instructions in first decrease round k3 k2tog k5 k2tog parentheses until the end of the round or around 70 sts on needle until instructed otherwise work 3 rounds in pattern k1tbl = knit one stitch through the back loop ● k3 p7 around this twists the stitch ● k around k2tog = knit 2 stitches together decreases ● k3 p7 around stitch count by 1 second decrease round k3 k2tog k3 p3tog = purl 3 stitches together decreases k2tog around 56 sts on needle stitch count by 2 work 3 rounds in pattern ● k3 p5 around ● k around ● k3 p5 around third decrease round k3 k2tog k1 k2tog around 42 sts on needle work 2 rounds in pattern ● k3 p3 around ● k around fourth decrease round k3 p3tog around 28 sts on needle k one round fifth decrease round k2tog around 14 sts on needle cut yarn leaving a long tail about 10 thread tail into a yarn needle and pass through all open stitches removing the knitting needles as you go pull this
